case_vignette: A 70-YEAR-OLD MAN PRESENTS WITH 1 YEAR OF A NON-HEALING GROWTH ON THE RIGHT CHEEK. HE SAYS HE FIRST NOTICED IT WHEN HE ACCIDENTALLY BUMPED INTO IT AND IT BLED EASILY. HE DENIES ANY PRECEDING TRAUMA TO THE LESION.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a non-healing growth on my right cheek that's been there for about a year.
Has the growth changed in size, color, or shape recently?
I haven't noticed any changes in size, color, or shape of the growth recently.
Do you have any pain or bleeding from the growth?
The growth bleeds easily, especially when I accidentally bump into it.
Do you have a history of excessive sun exposure or use of tanning beds?
I haven't mentioned any history about sun exposure or use of tanning beds.
Have you previously had any skin cancers or have a family history of skin cancer?
I haven't mentioned any personal or family history of skin cancers.
Do you have any other health issues or are you currently on any medications?
I haven't mentioned any other health issues or medications that I'm taking.
Final Diagnosis: Basal Cell Carcinoma
